coreIdentity.mission: Empowering creators with easy-to-understand, high-quality DTF printing knowledge and resources.
coreIdentity.vision: To make DTF printing simple, inspire creativity, and help our community succeed through practical, easy-to-follow content.
coreIdentity.tagline: Create. Inspire. Empower. Keep Chasing Brilliance.

voice.style: Conversational, like talking to a friend who’s an expert in DTF printing.

tone.overallTone: Encouraging, clear, and helpful with a touch of humor.

headers.H1: Main Title (e.g., 'How to Make Your DTF Prints Pop!')
headers.H3: Subsections (e.g., 'Choosing the Right Heat Press Settings')
headers.boldText: For key points or tips (e.g., 'Always preheat your garment!')
headers.bulletPoints: For lists, steps, or important details
headers.tables: For comparisons or detailed data (e.g., 'Heat Press Temperature Guide')

textStructure.paragraphLength: 1-2 sentences, to avoid overwhelming the reader

writingRules.example: Do: 'Set your heat press to 300°F for 15 seconds.' Don't: 'Ensure the application of thermal pressure at an optimal temperature of 300 degrees Fahrenheit for a period of 15 seconds.'

writingRules.rule: Explain complex ideas with everyday examples
writingRules.example: Do: 'Think of your heat press like a waffle maker. You need the right temperature and timing for a perfect print.'
Use numbered lists and images (e.g., '1. Place the transfer on the shirt, 2. Press for 15 seconds, 3. Peel the film slowly').

writingRules.rule: Use familiar language and avoid jargon
writingRules.example: Do: 'Make sure your artwork has a transparent background.' Don't: 'Ensure your design file utilizes an alpha channel for transparency.'
Include screenshots, diagrams, and before/after photos whenever possible.

structure: Start with an image or video preview
Break it down with simple diagrams

YouTube.style: High-energy, clear explanations with a focus on visual demonstrations and relatable analogies.

contentFormat: FAQs with visuals for common questions
Website/Blog.style: Informative, structured for scanning, and filled with helpful visuals.

contentFormat: Engaging polls and tips in stories
Social Media.style: Short, visual, and engaging. Use emojis and bright images to grab attention.

do: We get it—heat pressing can feel like baking cookies. Too hot, and you burn it. Too cold, and it doesn’t stick. Here’s how to get it just right every time! 🍪
Check out this video where we show you the easiest way to fix a peeling transfer. No stress, just results! 🎥
Need a softer feel? Lower your press temperature by 10°F and increase the press time by 5 seconds. Feels just like a retail tee! 👕
don't: Upon completion of the heat pressing process, assess the adherence of the transfer to the garment.
Refer to our extensive manual for further guidance on resolving application issues.
The process was adjusted to enhance the softness of the fabric.
